definition: to rise and fall in succession (idiom)/repeating continuously

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Each voice, rising and falling like the clamorous cackling of chickens.
sentences.chinese: 此起彼落的声音犹如小鸡咯咯的喧闹声。

sentences.english: Follow the media for the meeting, each flash bring height.
sentences.chinese: 跟随而来的媒体闪光灯此起彼落，为会场带来最高潮。

definition: small craftsman (contemptuous)/clatter (e.g. of footsteps)/jumbled mass/press of bodies/tumult
one after the other/a succession of/a series of
lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub
